section.name: Use Case Overview
section.P: To help define useful functionality for a Cytoscape data layer, we have defined 6 high-level use cases. These use cases (in rough order of priority) include:

UL.LI: Use Case 1: User selects a node and retrieves additional details about that node from one or more data sources. For example, the user may want to view the GenBank File for a selected node, or lookup known homologs.
Use Case 2: User wants to load interaction data from a remote data source, and immediately view the data within cytoscape. For example, the user may want to load data from GRID, or BIND.
Use Case 3: User wants to load a SIF/GML file from over the network.

Use Case 4: User selects a node and initiates a computational query that runs on a remote server. For example, the user can click on a node, and run a BLAST search via the NCBI QBlast API (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/BLAST/qblast.html).
Use Case 5: User creates a set of data within Cytoscape, and wants to submit that data to a remote database. For example, the user can submit new data to GRID or BIND.
Use Case 6: User selects a node and does a thesaurus look-up. For example, the user selects a node, and retrieves all aliases / synonyms for the gene/protein.

section.P: For the first iteration of development, our plan is to focus on specific portions of Use Cases 1 and 2. Details are available in the Phase 1 document.
